name: Egg Garlic Adlai Fried Rice
description: Dive into a plate of Egg Garlic Adlai Fried Rice, tailored to suit your health-centric lifestyle. Meticulously selected for those who prefer low-sugar and nutritious meals, this recipe transforms simple ingredients into a delightful fusion of flavors and textures. A perfect embodiment of 'healthy eating without sacrificing taste', it's crafted for those who seek to maintain a balanced diet while indulging in the pleasures of home-cooked comfort food.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, which takes about 20 minutes, then set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the eggs into a bowl, add salt, black pepper, and dried rosemary. Whisk until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Add the minced garlic to the skillet and saut√© until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and stir gently until the eggs are softly set, about 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked Adlai Rice to the skillet with the eggs. Stir and toss gently, breaking up the eggs and mixing them well with the rice. Cook for another 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Season the fried rice with additional salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
